channel.title: Just need a little help!
channel.description:
im tryna get my server online..
iv downloaded and registered with no-ip replaced all 127.0.0.1 from source+client to my no-ip changed my dynamic ip to static port forwarded (im sure i did it corectly) made exception in firewall so port 43594 is allowed i checked if my ip has been portforwarded from my portforward download checker from portforward website, they say its open for my computer, however when i go to canyouseeme.org, it says its not open? wtf? iv tried runnin my server n client and i cant login whats the problem?? would be grateful if u cud help !!!
edit: iv changed the ip from my rsps to my new static ip and it works, but dont work with my no-ip? whats wrong then???how do i fix it?? ty

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @Guardianman5 Guardianman5
item.description:
@Guardianman5 wrote:

Problem Solved.

Read full topic

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @Rexxy Rexxy
item.description:
@Rexxy wrote:

Open ports, setup no-ip, portforward, and run run.bat in your source.

Read full topic

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @warxscape warxscape
item.description:
@warxscape wrote:

Guardianman5:

You cannot connect to your server using your no-ip ip. You can only login using 127.0.0.1, others can login using your no-ip ip. so it may say error for you, but for others it is most likely working, change your client to 127.0.0.1 and you should be set. I can test it for you if you’d like me to.

ty i jus jarred the client, il send u the link inabit

edit: http://www.mediafire.com/?oyq7z257828s8q5

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Guardianman5 Guardianman5
item.description:
@Guardianman5 wrote:

You cannot connect to your server using your no-ip ip. You can only login using 127.0.0.1, others can login using your no-ip ip. so it may say error for you, but for others it is most likely working, change your client to 127.0.0.1 and you should be set. I can test it for you if you’d like me to.

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Go ahead, if you haven’t noticed, I’m the only one helping you. Get rude, I’ll stop. Then what do you do?

Read full topic

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @warxscape warxscape
item.description:
@warxscape wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:527785”][quote author=warxscape link=topic=646536.msg4348026#msg4348026 date=1376189199]

Is the server online when you’re checking?

no but the duc is

edit: oh lol thanks so servers on and canyouseemee said success, so now i can change my ip to http://www.whatismyip.com/
and when i give the client to OTHERS i must give it with no-ip replaced ? yep?

You don’t need to. The who reason No-IP was made was to mask people’s IP’s with a static address. It was to prevent server dc’s when a dynamic IP changes.

but itl still work if i do what i said right? cos when i add the no-ip on my rsps using my computer it dont let me login “error connecting to server”
[/quote]
Wow, you just don’t know how to read…

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=646536.msg4348011#msg4348011 date=1376187909]
If canyouseeme can’t see your computer then of course no one can connect.
You set it either to the IP found here. or using your no-ip.
Your static 192.168 IP is for local connections, example being if you had a brother on another computer connecting to your server.
[b][size=22pt]
Local Computer: Localhost
LAN (Local Area Network): Local IP (192.168.x.x)
Anyone else: http://whatismyip.com [Can be substituted for No-IP]
[/quote][/quote]

shutup bitch u get rude, il get rude

Read full topic

no but the duc is

edit: oh lol thanks so servers on and canyouseemee said success, so now i can change my ip to http://www.whatismyip.com/
and when i give the client to OTHERS i must give it with no-ip replaced ? yep?

You don’t need to. The who reason No-IP was made was to mask people’s IP’s with a static address. It was to prevent server dc’s when a dynamic IP changes.
[/quote]

but itl still work if i do what i said right? cos when i add the no-ip on my rsps using my computer it dont let me login “error connecting to server”[/quote]
Wow, you just don’t know how to read…

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:527785”]If canyouseeme can’t see your computer then of course no one can connect.
You set it either to the IP found here. or using your no-ip.
Your static 192.168 IP is for local connections, example being if you had a brother on another computer connecting to your server.
[b][size=22pt]
Local Computer: Localhost
LAN (Local Area Network): Local IP (192.168.x.x)
Anyone else: http://whatismyip.com [Can be substituted for No-IP][/quote]

Read full topic

and when i give the client to OTHERS i must give it with no-ip replaced ? yep?[/quote]
You don’t need to. The who reason No-IP was made was to mask people’s IP’s with a static address. It was to prevent server dc’s when a dynamic IP changes.

Local Computer: Localhost
LAN (Local Area Network): Local IP (192.168.x.x)
Anyone else: http://whatismyip.com[/quote]

ok i get that, but why cant canyouseeme not see my port, iv done all the steps… like i listed first comment

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If canyouseeme can’t see your computer then of course no one can connect.
You set it either to the IP found here. or using your no-ip.
Your static 192.168 IP is for local connections, example being if you had a brother on another computer connecting to your server.
Local Computer: Localhost
LAN (Local Area Network): Local IP (192.168.x.x)
Anyone else: http://whatismyip.com

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @warxscape warxscape
item.description:
@warxscape wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:527785”]Because you’re trying to connect to your own IP.
Your computer > Your network.
You’re trying to send a connection from your network, back to your network, when the connection doesn’t need to leave the computer.[/quote]

ok i get u, but whys the error in canyouseeme.org sayin the port 43594 is not open?

so basically i jus need to set the server on MY computer to the static ip i made right?

Read full topic

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Because you’re trying to connect to your own IP.
Your computer > Your network.
You’re trying to send a connection from your network, back to your network, when the connection doesn’t need to leave the computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @warxscape warxscape
item.description:
@warxscape wrote:

sk8rdude461:

No-IP is an IP masker, you need to have the DUC running at all times that the server is, in order for it to work. You also cannot connect to your no-ip from localhost, so you need to set it to localhost for you, No-IP for everyone else.

yh the duc is running, but i tried with no-ip and it aint working for me, if its not workin for me how is it going to work for others? ;O

Read full topic

item.title: Just need a little help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

No-IP is an IP masker, you need to have the DUC running at all times that the server is, in order for it to work. You also cannot connect to your no-ip from localhost, so you need to set it to localhost for you, No-IP for everyone else.

Read full topic

i checked if my ip has been portforwarded from my portforward download checker from portforward website, they say its open for my computer, however when i go to canyouseeme.org, it says its not open? wtf?
iv tried runnin my server n client and i cant login
whats the problem??

edit: iv changed the ip from my rsps to my new static ip and it works, but dont work with my no-ip? whats wrong then???how do i fix it?? ty
